page.title: 10COUSLAND-THE SCHOOL COOK
page.content: THE SCHOOL COOK HAS BEEN IN POST FOR 10 YEARS. SHE STARTS PREPARING MEAT AND POTATOES AT 8.30AM., HAS THE FOOD READY BY 12.15PM. AND FINISHES AT 2.30PM. SHE ENJOYS HER WORK BECAUSE SHE LIKES CHILDREN AND DOES SOMETHING DIFFERENT EVERY DAY. IN HER KITCHEN, SHE HAS A LARGE COOKER, POTATO PEELER, CHIP-MAKER, CAN-OPENER, AND TWO MIXING MACHINES TO HELP HER. SHE PREFERS MAKING SCONES BY HAND. SHE PREPARES ABOUT 100 MEALS PER WEEK. IN ONE YEAR SHE USES 12 CHICKENS, 50KG.SHOULDER STEAK, 500KG. POTATOES, 20KG. SAUSAGES, 25KG. BACON, 45KG. CARROTS AND ONIONS, 55KG. TURNIP, 20KG. HAGGIS, 100 LITRES OF MILK. THE MENUS ARE PLANNED A MONTH IN ADVANCE. DURING THE LAST TEN YEARS LESS MEAT HAS BEEN SERVED, BEING REPLACED BY e.g. CURRY OR HOT DOGS.
